column2: Technical competencies:   Education and knowledge in Mechanical / Electrical, or   Marine Engineering is essential.   Good project management and contract administrative   skills.   Knowledge and experience in Ship yard or a similar   facility with MC activities works for conversion and new buildings.   Good knowledge and experience in different process   involved in construction activities and related quality requirements.   Sound knowledge in MC activities, Certification   requirements and regulatory requirements of Marine and Offshore, process and   Drilling equipment.   Familiar with Norsok standards, class rules and   ship building standards.   Strong background with resolution of technical   issues during projects planning and execution phases.   Conversant with permit to work system and lock out   tag out system.   Experience in mechanical completion, Commissioning   and preservation procedures.   Knowledge and experience in project completion   software such as WinPCS, PIMS, Procosys etc.   Join our dynamic team and advance your career with us. Don't miss out on this excellent opportunity. Interested candidates can share their resume at ankita.batham@drydocks.gov.ae.
column11: GO Completion, Orbital Welding, WinPcs, Petropcs, PIMS, Zenator

column2: Perform engineering planning and assessments of marine facilities, including berthing, mooring, cargo-handling, fire protection, pollution prevention and other facilities         Assist in commissioning and troubleshooting of new structures and equipment         Perform operational assessments to assist facilities with risk management activities and assuring compliance with industry/company standards         Conduct mooring and berthing engineering evaluations to define Vessel Acceptance Criteria, mooring requirements and Environmental Operating Limits         Provide post incident response to terminals for continued operations         Participate in development of company/industry standards. Interpret and explain company practices and industry standards and how they apply to ongoing operation of facilities and projects         Provide interface with business units, regulatory agencies, and industry organizations         This position requires domestic and international tra     Skills      Qualifications         B.S. Civil/Structural Engineering from a recognized university (with GPA 6.0 and above)         M.S. degree in engineering in civil or marine related discipline will be an advantage         5 years of engineering experience in the design, maintenance, or operations of jetties, coastal infrastructure, marine terminal facilities or industrial structures         Minimum 5 years of relevant industry experience         Previous technical position within a manufacturing plant is preferred         Candidates should be self-motivated and focused on achieving business results         Solid technical and analytical skills         Strong communication, innovative thinking, and teamwork capabilities         Demonstrated leadership experience         Willing to travel domestically and internationally         Willing to work in shifts (1.30 PM 10.30 PM IST)         Preferred Knowledge/Skills/Experience         Candidates who have a background in engineering areas such as those below and who can quickly adapt their skills will be strongly considered.         Relevant knowledge and experience includes the following:         Knowledge of key industry guidelines for marine such as OCIMF and PIANC         Experience in performing mooring analysis and fender design         Capable of reading and interpreting drawings and specifications for typical marine terminal components (cargo transfer systems, mooring, fenders, gangways, etc.)         Experience with sizing and lay out of marine terminal structures and facilities based on ship/shore interface requirements (e.g., ship size, effective mooring layouts, gangway and loading arm or hose operating envelopes, etc.)         Experience in design and construction of shore berths         Experience in assessing existing operations including procedures/facilities
column11: Analytical skills, Cargo, Civil, Planning engineering, Structural engineering, Fire protection, Troubleshooting, Risk management, Operations, Cargo handling
